intro: Gundelia tournefortii var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth Gundelia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its hairy, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its smooth, glabrous leaves distinguish it from other varieties of Gundelia.
